title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that Elephas-2 has 13 sequence differences from the reference animal or that this is the greatest number of all animals in the table.
The response indicates that Elephas-2 has 13 sequence differences from the reference animal, and this is the greatest number of all animals in the table.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that from left to right, the order at the tips of the cladogram is: Dugong, Elephas, Loxodonta, Mammathus or that Loxodonta and Mammuthus can also be reversed.

The response indicates that from left to right, the order at the tips of the cladogram is: Dugong, Elephas, Loxodonta, Mammathus. Loxodonta and Mammuthus can also be reversed. (Common names can be used; full species names can also be used).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that molecular data, such as that for a widely conserved protein such as cytochrome b MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGIbaaaa@39E5@ , show conserved similarities between organisms such as dugongs and proboscideans and can be used to support the existence of this relationship.

The response indicates that molecular data, such as that for a widely conserved protein such as cytochrome b MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGIbaaaa@39E5@ , show conserved similarities between organisms such as dugongs and proboscideans and can be used to support the existence of this relationship.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that animals that are related once had a common ancestor with certain genetic characteristics. Adaption to different habitats leads to diversification of morphology but does not change evolutionary relationships.

The response indicates that animals that are related once had a common ancestor with certain genetic characteristics. Adaption to different habitats leads to diversification of morphology but does not change evolutionary relationships.
